titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert W. Honnoll Letters, 1862

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters of Lieutenant Honnoll concerning camp life and family matters, and commenting on prospects for peace and opposition to Lincoln in the North.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Robert W. Honnoll letters, 1862, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Robert W. Honnoll was a Confederate Army officer of the 23rd Regiment, Tennessee Volunteers, stationed at Corinth, Mississippi.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters of Lieutenant Honnoll concerning camp life and family matters, and commenting on prospects for peace and opposition to Lincoln in the North.
